page.title: 10LOCAL GOVERNMENT
page.content: WE HAD A VISIT FROM OUR REGIONAL COUNCILLOR RECENTLY AND SHE TOLD US ABOUT LOCAL GOVERNMENT. FIRSTLY, THERE ARE COMMUNITY COUNCILS. OUR COUNCIL IS CALLED THE LAMANCHA, NEWLANDS AND KIRKURD COMMUNITY COUNCIL AND SOME OF OUR PARENTS MEET EVERY MONTH TO DISCUSS PROBLEMS OR SUGGEST IMPROVEMENTS IN THE ENVIRONMENT. THEN THERE IS THE DISTRICT COUNCIL FOR TWEEDALE, BASED IN PEEBLES. IT DEALS WITH COUNCIL HOUSING, REFUSE COLLECTION, TOURISM AND PARKS. NEXT THERE IS THE BORDERS REGIONAL COUNCIL WITH ITS HEADQUARTERS IN NEWTOWN ST. BOSWELLS. MANY PEOPLE THERE DEAL WITH EDUCATION, LIBRARIES, PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT, SOCIAL WORK, ROADS, RATES, WATER AND DRAINAGE AND DECIDE IN COMMITTEES HOW THERE BUDGET SHOULD BE USED.
